definition: Sakya (name of a north Indian tribe)/abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼 Sakyamuni Buddha/sugar apple
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
(phonetic sound for Buddhist terms)
Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism/Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism

sentences.english: Sakyamuni was thus able to continue his journey.
sentences.chinese: 释迦牟尼由此得以继续行程。

sentences.english: The continuing education system for teachers was first established by Buddha Shakyamuni.
sentences.chinese: 教师进修的制度是释迦牟尼佛首创的。

sentences.english: The first eight stupas were created to hold the Buddha's remains.
sentences.chinese: 最初的八座佛塔中安放的就是释迦牟尼的佛骨舍利。

sentences.english: It is a famous temple in China. It was built in ancient times to house the fingerbones of Sakyamuni, the founder of Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 它是我国古代安置释迦牟尼佛骨舍利的著名寺院。

sentences.english: He is the right retinue, one of the Three Saints of Hua-yen.
sentences.chinese: 为释迦牟尼的右胁侍，“华严三圣”之一。

sentences.english: At the age of thirty, the Buddha sat under the Bodhi Tree and attained Proper Enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 释迦牟尼佛在三十岁时，于菩提树下证得正觉。

sentences.english: Sugar apple is a medium-sized tropical fruit.
sentences.chinese: 释迦是一种中等大小的热带水果。

sentences.english: It is said that Sakyamuni was the founder of the Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 据说释迦摩尼是佛教的创始人。

sentences.english: Then why did Buddha Shakyamuni not tell us so directly?
sentences.chinese: 那么释迦牟尼佛为什么不直截了当的告诉我们呢？

sentences.english: It is just like Sakyamuni Buddha, who showed the world these merits through his prince identity.
sentences.chinese: 比如我们的导师释迦佛，就是以王子身份显现的。

sentences.english: The image of the main Buddha is mainly Sakyamuni, the founder of Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 中间主佛的形象主要是佛教的创始人释迦。

sentences.english: He had gained the most supreme wisdom and understood things as they truly are.
sentences.chinese: 释迦牟尼获得了无上智慧，知道了事情的根本。

sentences.english: Sakyamuni Buddha originally attained to the state of Suchness, where sicknesses are absent.
sentences.chinese: 教主释迦牟尼佛本来已达到没有病痛的境界。

sentences.english: Was the Lord Buddha a sexist?
sentences.chinese: 释迦牟尼佛是男性至上主义者吗？

sentences.english: On one occasion, Mahakasyapa returned from far away to see Shakyamuni Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，他从很远的地方回来，拜访释迦牟尼佛。

definition: Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism/Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
Buddha (a person who has attained Buddhahood, or specifically Siddhartha Gautama)
World Honored One/Revered One of the World (Buddha)
Manjushri, the Bodhisattva of keen awareness
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
Buddha/Buddhism
(female) head ornament/variant of 彿|佛[fu2]
seemingly
Buddha/founder of a buddhist sect
Nagarjuna (Nagarjuna Bodhisattva)
Maitreya Bodhisattva
abbr. for 阿羅漢|阿罗汉[a1 luo2 han4]
Dipamkara Buddha, the former Buddha before Shakyamuni Buddha and the bringer of lights
Vairocana, Buddha of supreme enlightenment
ashes after cremation/Buddhist relics (Sanskirt: sarira)
